abstract.p: John Schroeder letter on Leslie Camhi's July 23 article questions why it is considered undignified for Tammy Faye Messner to be icon for gay community; photo (S)

block.p: In her article about Tammy Faye Messner [''The Fabulousness of Tammy Faye,'' July 23], Leslie Camhi poses the question, ''In the twilight of her celebrity, must she suffer a final indignity by being resurrected as a gay icon?'' What is the indignity in being revered by a community of people? Are gay icons less respected because the gay community has chosen to embrace them for who they are? This comment comes across as an insult to Tammy Faye, to other gay icons, and to gay men and women everywhere.
